Run nf-core/rnaseq pipeline on Apollo

Source: R/rnaseq.R, R/smrnaseq.R
run_nf_core_rnaseq.Rd

Makes an sbatch job script for the nf-core/rnaseq pipeline and submits it to the Apollo cluster. The pipeline version is specified by the rnaseq_release parameter in the _targets.R file. The default parameters are used for the pipeline, in addition to --pseudo_aligner salmon and --deseq2_vst.

Makes an sbatch job script for the nf-core/smrnaseq pipeline and submits it to the Apollo cluster. The pipeline version is specified by the smrnaseq_release parameter in the _targets.R file. The default parameters are used for the pipeline.

Makes an sbatch job script for cutadapt and submits it to the Apollo cluster, one job per library.

Usage

run_nf_core_rnaseq(run_folder, sample_sheet, ref_genome, qc = TRUE)

run_nfcore_smrnaseq(
  run_folder,
  sample_sheet,
  clip_r1_3p = NULL,
  species = "mmu"
)

run_cutadapt_smrna(sample_sheet)

Arguments

run_folder

subfolder in which to run nextflow, keeps the pipeline from overwriting previous runs and enables the -resume feature of Nextflow.

sample_sheet

nf-core sample sheet with the columns sample_id, library_id, fastq_1

ref_genome

nf-core reference genome, see Reference Genomes for supported references

qc

run the full QC pipeline with STAR_Salmon, or Salmon pseudoalignment only, skipping all QC steps (default: TRUE)

clip_r1_3p

number of bases to trim from reads.

species

mmu or hsa. If mmu, additionally sets the 3' adapter to TCTGGAATTCTCGGGTGCCAAGGAACTCC. For hsa, the 3' adapter is auto-discovered.

Value

a path to the run script, or the multiqc report if it exists.

a path to the run script, or the multiqc report if it exists.

a data.frame with the columns library_id, fastq_1, ready to be used as input to the nf-core pipeline

Details

Execution of the pipeline is independent of the package build script, allowing asynchronous development. If no run_folder exists, it will be created along with a sample_sheet.csv and run_{ref_genome}.sh, which is submitted via sbatch. A successful run is detected by the presence of a a multiqc report. An existing run script wont be overwritten by this function so it must be deleted manually.
